EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Sink Chest & Output Extraction System:
 – Sink Chest: Wooden Chest successfully placed at (-11.5, -46.5).
 – Sink Inserter: Burner Inserter placed at (-10.5, -46.5), rotated to face LEFT, with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5) (currently reporting “NO_FUEL” with a warning of “out of fuel”).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup connecting the mining drill drop at (-14.5, -48.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) using 8 belts (inventory contains {'iron-ore': 3}, status WORKING).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement Range and Buildability:
 – When placement errors indicate “target position is too far away,” ensure the player is moved close to the intended placement location before attempting.
 – If a direct placement is reported as “not buildable,” use the nearest_buildable function to find a valid candidate.
• Undefined Variables and Nil References:
 – NameError issues (e.g. “intermediate_belt is not defined”) and nil reference errors (attempting to index a nil ref_entity) call for pre-validating that all temporary variables and references are correctly set before use.
• Occupied Tile Conflicts:
 – Errors reporting that a transport belt or burner-inserter already exists at the target position signal that the target cell is occupied. Adjust spacing, change direction, or choose an alternate reference position.
• Belt Connection Targeting:
 – Connection failures when directly linking transport belts to a wooden chest (Prototype.WoodenChest) must be resolved by inserting an appropriate inserter between the belt and the chest.
• Object Attribute Misuse:
 – Attribute errors on BeltGroup objects (such as accessing a “direction” property) indicate that only the proper attributes of individual belts should be used.
• Fuel Shortages:
 – If a sink inserter or similar entity reports “out of fuel” despite being placed correctly, monitor and replenish fuel to ensure continuous operation.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly.  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement.  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement.  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors.

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing.  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity if the target cell is buildable and unoccupied.  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position.
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target.
